cryptonote_mining_pool.description: Setting up a CryptoNote mining pool with web login (2026 guide)
cryptonote_mining_pool.overview: In 2026, CryptoNote mining pools require blockchain daemons, Node.js backend, and a web dashboard. Claude Code can handle the full stack.

core_infrastructure.daemon: Run the coin's daemon (e.g., monerod or specific CryptoNote coin daemon) to see new blocks
core_infrastructure.wallet: View-only wallet or RPC-enabled wallet to track payments and pool fees
core_infrastructure.pool_software: Clone repos like dvandal/cryptonote-nodejs-pool - high-performance with built-in API

webpage_setup.dashboard_location: Most repos have website/ or website_example/ folder
webpage_setup.login_mechanism: User 'login' is actually their wallet address - enter address to see hashrate and pending balance
webpage_setup.deployment: Install Nginx/Apache, move website/ files to /var/www/html, edit config.js to point to Pool API URL

step_by_step.1_environment: Install dependencies: Node.js, Redis, libssl-dev, Boost
step_by_step.2_clone: Clone dvandal/cryptonote-nodejs-pool and run npm install
step_by_step.3_configuration: Configure config.json with pool wallet address and daemon IP
step_by_step.4_web_hosting: Set up Nginx to host /website directory at domain
step_by_step.5_ssl: Use Certbot for free SSL certificate (HTTPS) for secure login

user_login_flow.no_password: Users don't need passwords (though some pools support them for worker ID)
user_login_flow.process: Paste public address into search bar on webpage
user_login_flow.api_call: Page makes AJAX call to pool API and displays individual miner stats

icloud_custom_email_setup.description: Setting up professional website email through iCloud Custom Email Domain (2026)
icloud_custom_email_setup.overview: Configure custom domain email (hello@vankushfamily.com) with iCloud - DNS records act as postal instructions

dns_records.mx: Mail Exchange - directs email to Apple servers instead of web host
dns_records.spf: Sender Policy Framework - validates sender, prevents spam
dns_records.dkim: DomainKeys Identified Mail - authentication, prevents spam folder

claude_code_assistance.limitations: Cannot log into private Apple Account for security
claude_code_assistance.capabilities: Can configure Hostinger server to talk to iCloud, automate DNS setup
claude_code_assistance.dns_automation: Log into Hostinger hPanel via API/SSH, automatically enter MX/TXT records
claude_code_assistance.verification: Run DNS check to verify records are live before clicking Apple Verify button

step_a_apple.1: Go to iCloud.com/settings → Custom Email Domain
step_a_apple.2: Choose 'Add a domain you own' → enter vankushfamily.com
step_a_apple.3: Apple shows list of DNS Records - copy these for Claude Code

step_b_hostinger.command: Claude, I'm setting up iCloud Mail for my domain. Here are DNS records from Apple. Log into Hostinger DNS zone and update MX, SPF, DKIM records to match exactly.
step_b_hostinger.action: Claude uses Computer Use/API to delete old Hostinger mail records, replace with Apple ones

common_failures.conflicting_records: Hostinger default MX records still active - email gets confused, won't arrive at Apple
common_failures.propagation_time: Up to 24 hours for internet to update after DNS changes
common_failures.missing_spf_dkim: Only MX record set, no TXT (SPF) - emails go to spam folders

managing_claude_context_limits.description: Best practices for managing Claude's 200K context window and avoiding usage limits (2026)
managing_claude_context_limits.overview: Shift from asking for everything at once to Modular Orchestration

understanding_limits.context_window: 200K+ tokens - Claude's short-term memory, re-reads entire history each message
understanding_limits.memory_bloat: Long code + long history = exponential memory fill → Limit Reached message faster
understanding_limits.output_truncation: Regular Claude stops around 4,000-8,000 tokens per response
understanding_limits.not_broken: Truncation is hard limit on tokens generated per response, not a bug

claude_code_advantages.incremental_editing: Uses diffs instead of rewriting entire files - 10x more token-efficient
claude_code_advantages.agentic_persistence: Automatically continues large tasks across multiple steps without re-prompting
claude_code_advantages.plan_mode: Use /plan to outline architecture first, then execute piece by piece - prevents token bloat

tips_to_prevent_limits.start_fresh_often: Once feature works, start new chat - copy working code + CLAUDE.md plan to reset memory bloat, get 100% limit back
tips_to_prevent_limits.xml_tags: Claude trained to be efficient with XML - <logic> for BLURT listener, <ui> for Discord interface keeps focus
tips_to_prevent_limits.concise_mode: Tell Claude: 'I am on usage limit. No explanations. No comments. Just raw functional code.'
tips_to_prevent_limits.modular_building: Don't ask for full system at once - build Identity Module → Blockchain Connector → Discord Listener separately

code_modifications_required: Replace coin identifier (BTC, DOGE, LTC, etc.) with your identifier
Change Subsidy value (coins rewarded per block mined)
Change Block Time (time between new blocks)
Change Block Height (total blocks that will ever exist)
Change Halving Time (when mining rewards halve)
Modify Genesis Block (remove everything except x0)
Update Headline with current news headline
Update Epoch Time to current time
Create graphics (wallet icon, loading screen, sidebar)
Compile code and handle fatal error (extract Merkle Root and Nnonce)

key_parameters_explained.halving_time: Interval when rewards halve (Bitcoin: ~4 years, creates scarcity)
key_parameters_explained.genesis_block: First block in blockchain, establishes coin parameters
key_parameters_explained.merkle_root: Cryptographic hash of all transactions in block
key_parameters_explained.nnonce: Number used once in mining algorithm
key_parameters_explained.checkpoints: Block hashes used to prevent blockchain reorganization
